page.title: 04GLYN CEIRIOG MUSEUMS.
page.content: In Glyn Ceiriog there are three small museums, which are open to the public at different times of the day and week. In the Glyn Valley Hotel are a wide selection of pictures showing the old railway that ran from the quarries at Pandy to the canal wharf at Chirk.The railway carried passengers and freight. The Ceiriog Institute has a museum which has busts and portraits of people, local antiquarian 'finds' and other objects of local interest. The museum/display at Chwarel Wynne Mine, has photographs and many examples of equipment and tools used in slate quarrying.
